subject: Ethics
title: Ethics vs Compliance
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Ethics vs Compliance.

hook.text: A company follows every law perfectly and still poisons a river. Legal? Yes. Ethical? That's the gap.

buildup.text: Compliance means following rules. Ethics means doing rightâ€”even when no rule requires it.

discovery.text: Laws set the floor. Ethics sets the ceiling. Most corporate scandals happen in the space between.

twist.text: Companies spend billions on compliance departments but often treat ethics training as a checkbox exercise.

climax.text: Enron had a 64-page code of ethics. It won awards for it. Then it committed the largest fraud in US history.

punchline.text: A rulebook on the shelf isn't ethics. It's furniture.

quiz.question: What is the key difference between ethics and compliance?
options: They mean exactly the same thing
Compliance follows laws; ethics goes beyond legal requirements to do what's right
Ethics only applies to individuals, not companies
